title: Choi–Williams distribution function
summary: Choi–Williams distribution function is one of the members of Cohen's class distribution function.[1] It was first proposed by Hyung-Ill Choi and William J. Williams in 1989. This distribution function adopts exponential kernel to suppress the cross-term. However, the kernel gain does not decrease along the η , τ {\displaystyle \eta ,\tau } axes in the ambiguity domain. Consequently, the kernel function of Choi–Williams distribution function can only filter out the cross-terms that result from the components that differ in both time and frequency center.
